item.title: Town police departments taking bite out of K-9 units
item.description: Since Brighton eliminated its K-9 program earlier this year, the sheriff's office, the city of Rochester and the state police have been the only agencies in Monroe County to still offer the service.

item.title: Difficult N.Y. budget process on horizon
item.description: An embattled governor. A state Senate without a clear majority. A burgeoning budget gap. Add it all up and some state officials predict a long and arduous budget process.

item.title: East Rochester school district jobs saved with stimulus funds
item.description: The American Recovery and Reinvestment Act, passed by Congress in 2009, will soon funnel about $28 million into Rochester-area schools.

item.title: Rochester to begin using traffic cameras in July
item.description: A city-hired consultant has begun conducting video surveys of intersections to help decide where to place red light-enforcement cameras.

item.title: Genesee Country Village & Museum's Sap, Syrup & Sugar event offers sweet lesson in history
item.description: The Genesee Country Village & Museum's annual Sap, Syrup & Sugar weekends kicked off this weekend with maple syrup-making demonstrations and a pancake breakfast.

item.title: Seneca Falls' fate in voters' hands
item.description: Voters will decide Tuesday whether the village of 6,600 should be absorbed into the surrounding rural town of the same name beginning in 2012.

item.title: Balloons rise in memory of Hunter Resch
item.description: Hundreds gathered at Braddock Bay marina Sunday to "send a balloon to Hunter."

item.title: MCC downtown campus search advances
item.description: Efforts to locate a site for a new downtown Monroe Community College campus are moving ahead, with representatives of the firm helping with the selection slated to meet with MCC officials next Monday.

item.title: Greece schools seek public's budget input
item.description: The input session scheduled for Tuesday is not the official public hearing on the budget, which will be held in April after a formal budget proposal is approved by the board.

item.title: Soap Box racers apply savvy to score points
item.description: Youths from across the state and the country gathered in the Main Street Armory for a two-day, indoor Soap Box Derby rally race.

item.title: Penfield marks 200th anniversary by seeking residents' stories
item.description: Rather than focusing on the formal history of Penfield, a new book on Penfield will instead feature narratives and anecdotes from the town's current and former residents.

item.title: Hundreds to lobby for ethics reform
item.description: Good-government groups say they have reserved May 5 as a day to get answers and commitments from lawmakers and gubernatorial candidates on ethics reform.

item.title: News briefs
item.description: Nicer weather comes Tuesday

item.title: Power outage hits 3 towns
item.description: About 1,900 customers were without power in Henrietta, Pittsford and Mendon on Sunday evening because of an equipment malfunction at a substation on Mendon Center Road.

item.title: Fort Hood honors soldier
item.description: Pfc. Daniel Rivera was among 69 soldiers remembered during a memorial service Friday at Ft. Hood in Killeen, Texas.

item.title: Fire suspected to be arson
item.description: Rochester Fire Department officials say a fire that caused heavy damage to a west side home may have been intentionally set.

item.title: Shot at Hollywood something Paul Napier 'had to try'
item.description: This is the second part of a profile of Paul Napier, former Amerks public address announcer and local sports broadcaster, who went to Hollywood in 1964 to become an actor.

item.title: East Rochester, Perinton police reports: 3 arrested in gas station burglary
item.description: Here are some recent items from police records in East Rochester and Perinton. Reports are updated on Mondays or as they become available.

item.title: Chili police reports: Counterfeit money passed at store
item.description: Here are some recent items from police records in Chili. Reports are updated on Mondays or as they become available.

item.title: Gates police reports: Laptop stolen from unlocked car
item.description: Here are some recent items from police records in Gates. Reports are updated on Mondays or as they become available.
